We stayed in Bina and Justin’s cottage for a weekend getaway for hiking. But we wanted the comforts of a house and access to restaurants etc. Lewisburg and their cottage was perfect! About an hour away from multiple parks (we hiked at Ricketts Glen and Colonel Denning state parks) and in a small college town with good restaurants and coffee shops, etc, we felt at home immediately. It was great coming back to a clean and comfortable place to relax after a day hiking.
The cottage is charming and spotless clean! Bina was quick in responding to my questions about covid precautions. We felt very safe. The amenities were awesome. The little touches made it feel like coming home - leaving us local coffee and bathroom soaps. They have a communal backyard with chairs and a hammock that we spent some time with wine relaxing. Even though there are houses close by, it was very quiet and calm. And we were literally a block from the small downtown so we walked to restaurants and ice cream etc.
Bina, Justin, and little Aryeh (and their friendly cat) were so kind and welcoming while giving us privacy too. Bina was so responsive. I had absolutely no concerns about booking even during the pandemic. And Bina’s recommendations for places to eat did not disappoint!
Lewisburg is a charming community that emphasizes inclusion and respect which, as an interracial couple traveling in central PA (you never know), was much appreciated. When you visit, we recommend stopping by Amami for coffee and sweet treats, Grams for brunch, Siam for Thai and cocktails, and Brasserie Louis for dinner. All with outdoor dining!
All in all, we highly recommend staying at the Lewisburg cottage!

Lamar and Amanda's homestead is beautiful, and was a wonderful spot for our families to get together. We had 5 adults and 5 young children staying with us.
When you walk in the front door the kitchen is on the left, the living room is in front of you, and the stairs to the second floor is on the left. There is a lot of open space between the living room and stairs that we utilized for toys for the kids. Upstairs are three bedrooms. The master bedroom has a bathroom connected to it with a shower, and the first bathroom has a bathtub. Outside has a seating area, a hot tub, a firepit area, a gazebo and loads of open space. They have a comfortable 3 season porch, too. We didn't end up using the hot tub or firepit but they look to be in great condition! They supply wood for the firepit. Anytime I reached out to Amanda/Lamar they were VERY quick to respond which was awesome.
The house was very clean when we got there and is decorated very cutely. There are a few kids toys/books available in a bin at the top of the stairs next to a kids chair. They have 2 pack and plays available and 2 highchairs. They also left out 2 baby gates so we could block off the stairs. Very kid friendly!
There were many house flies, but it's a farm - and that's totally normal. There's a fly swatter and the kids loved pointing them out to us. We didn't have any upstairs the whole time.
Overall we had an excellent weekend and will look to come back if the need arises again :)
